alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:23PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND EAST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 323 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Capulin, or 11 miles south of Des Moines, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, Grenville, Capulin and Mount Dora. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 374 and 412. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
